definition: birdwatching
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis

sentences.english: There are a few good places to watch from quite near home.
sentences.chinese: 我家附近就有幾個相當好的賞鳥地點。

sentences.english: I've seen many people in London who are interested in bird watching.
sentences.chinese: 我看到倫敦很多人對賞鳥感興趣。

sentences.english: LITTER. See that your birding haunts are kept tidy.
sentences.chinese: 應保持賞鳥地點的清潔。

sentences.english: Bird watching? Yes, my son actually works in a zoo.
sentences.chinese: 賞鳥？是的，事實上我的兒子在動物園裏工作。

sentences.english: Why don't you come bird-watching with me this weekend?
sentences.chinese: 這個週末你何不和我一起去賞鳥。

sentences.english: She has gone in for bird-watching since she moved to London.
sentences.chinese: 她自從搬到倫敦，就熱衷於賞鳥。
